47 # We use the termcolor module (if available) to enable us to produce
48 # coloured, textual representations of Invoke schedules. If it's not
49 # available then we don't use colour.
50 try:
51  from termcolor import colored
52 except ImportError:
53  # We don't have the termcolor package available so provide
54  # alternative routine
55  def colored(text, _):
56  '''
57  Returns the supplied text argument unchanged. This is a swap-in
58  replacement for when termcolor.colored is not available.
59 
60  :param text: Text to return
61  :type text: string
62  :param _: Fake argument, only required to match interface
63  provided by termcolor.colored
64  :return: The supplied text, unchanged
65  :rtype: string
66  '''
67  return text

69 # The types of 'intent' that an argument to a Fortran subroutine
70 # may have
71 FORTRAN_INTENT_NAMES = ["inout", "out", "in"]
72 
73 # The following mappings will be set by a particular API if supported
74 # and required. We provide a default here for API's which do not have
75 # their own mapping (or support this mapping). This allows codes with
76 # no support to run.
77 # MAPPING_REDUCTIONS gives the names of reduction operations
78 MAPPING_REDUCTIONS = {"sum": "sum"}
79 # OMP_OPERATOR_MAPPING is used to determine the operator to use in the
80 # reduction clause of an OpenMP directive. All code for OpenMP
81 # directives exists in psyGen.py so this mapping should not be
82 # overidden.
83 OMP_OPERATOR_MAPPING = {"sum": "+"}
84 # REDUCTION_OPERATOR_MAPPING is used to determine the operator to use
85 # when creating a loop to sum partial sums sequentially, in order to
86 # get reproducible results. The LHS is the datatype of the field in
87 # question so needs to be overidden by the particular API.
88 REDUCTION_OPERATOR_MAPPING = {"sum": "+"}
89 # Names of types of scalar variable
90 MAPPING_SCALARS = {"iscalar": "iscalar", "rscalar": "rscalar"}
91 # Types of access for a kernel argument
92 MAPPING_ACCESSES = {"inc": "inc", "write": "write",
93  "read": "read", "readwrite": "readwrite"}
94 # Valid types of argument to a kernel call
95 VALID_ARG_TYPE_NAMES = []
96 # List of all valid access types for a kernel argument
97 VALID_ACCESS_DESCRIPTOR_NAMES = []
98 
99 # Colour map to use when writing Invoke schedule to terminal. (Requires
100 # that the termcolor package be installed. If it isn't then output is not
101 # coloured.) See https://pypi.python.org/pypi/termcolor for details.
102 SCHEDULE_COLOUR_MAP = {"Schedule": "white",
103  "Loop": "red",
104  "GlobalSum": "cyan",
105  "Directive": "green",
106  "HaloExchange": "blue",
107  "HaloExchangeStart": "yellow",
108  "HaloExchangeEnd": "yellow",
109  "Call": "magenta",
110  "KernCall": "magenta",
111  "Profile": "green",
112  "If": "red",
113  "Assignment": "blue",
114  "Reference": "yellow",
115  "BinaryOperation": "blue",
116  "Literal": "yellow",
117  "CodeBlock": "red"}

120 def get_api(api):
121  ''' If no API is specified then return the default. Otherwise, check that
122  the supplied API is valid.
123  :param str api: The PSyclone API to check or an empty string.
124  :returns: The API that is in use.
125  :rtype: str
126  :raises GenerationError: if the specified API is not supported.
127 
128  '''
129  if api == "":
130  api = Config.get().default_api
131  else:
132  if api not in Config.get().supported_apis:
133  raise GenerationError("get_api: Unsupported API '{0}' "
134  "specified. Supported types are "
135  "{1}.".format(api,
136  Config.get().supported_apis))
137  return api

140 def zero_reduction_variables(red_call_list, parent):
141  '''zero all reduction variables associated with the calls in the call
142  list'''
143  if red_call_list:
144  from psyclone.f2pygen import CommentGen
145  parent.add(CommentGen(parent, ""))
146  parent.add(CommentGen(parent, " Zero summation variables"))
147  parent.add(CommentGen(parent, ""))
148  for call in red_call_list:
149  call.zero_reduction_variable(parent)
150  parent.add(CommentGen(parent, ""))

153 def args_filter(arg_list, arg_types=None, arg_accesses=None, arg_meshes=None,
154  is_literal=True):
155  '''
156  Return all arguments in the supplied list that are of type
157  arg_types and with access in arg_accesses. If these are not set
158  then return all arguments.
159 
160  :param arg_list: List of kernel arguments to filter
161  :type arg_list: list of :py:class:`psyclone.parse.Descriptor`
162  :param arg_types: List of argument types (e.g. "GH_FIELD")
163  :type arg_types: list of str
164  :param arg_accesses: List of access types that arguments must have
165  :type arg_accesses: list of str
166  :param arg_meshes: List of meshes that arguments must be on
167  :type arg_meshes: list of str
168  :param bool is_literal: Whether or not to include literal arguments in \
169  the returned list.
170  :returns: list of kernel arguments matching the requirements
171  :rtype: list of :py:class:`psyclone.parse.Descriptor`
172  '''
173  arguments = []
174  for argument in arg_list:
175  if arg_types:
176  if argument.type.lower() not in arg_types:
177  continue
178  if arg_accesses:
179  if argument.access.lower() not in arg_accesses:
180  continue
181  if arg_meshes:
182  if argument.mesh not in arg_meshes:
183  continue
184  if not is_literal:
185  # We're not including literal arguments so skip this argument
186  # if it is literal.
187  if argument.is_literal:
188  continue
189  arguments.append(argument)
190  return arguments

193 class GenerationError(Exception):
194  ''' Provides a PSyclone specific error class for errors found during PSy
195  code generation. '''
196  def __init__(self, value):
197  Exception.__init__(self, value)
198  self.value = "Generation Error: "+value
199 
200  def __str__(self):
201  return repr(self.value)

204 class FieldNotFoundError(Exception):
205  ''' Provides a PSyclone-specific error class when a field with the
206  requested property/ies is not found '''
207  def __init__(self, value):
208  Exception.__init__(self, value)
209  self.value = "Field not found error: "+value
210 
211  def __str__(self):
212  return repr(self.value)

215 class InternalError(Exception):
216  '''
217  PSyclone-specific exception for use when an internal error occurs (i.e.
218  something that 'should not happen').
219 
220  :param str value: the message associated with the error.
221  '''
222  def __init__(self, value):
223  Exception.__init__(self, value)
224  self.value = "PSyclone internal error: "+value

226  def __str__(self):

230 class PSyFactory(object):
231  '''
232  Creates a specific version of the PSy. If a particular api is not
233  provided then the default api, as specified in the psyclone.cfg
234  file, is chosen.
235  '''
236  def __init__(self, api="", distributed_memory=None):
237  '''Initialises a factory which can create API specific PSY objects.
238  :param str api: Name of the API to use.
239  :param bool distributed_memory: True if distributed memory should be \
240  supported.
241  '''
242  if distributed_memory is None:
243  _distributed_memory = Config.get().distributed_memory
244  else:
245  _distributed_memory = distributed_memory
246 
247  if _distributed_memory not in [True, False]:
248  raise GenerationError(
249  "The distributed_memory flag in PSyFactory must be set to"
250  " 'True' or 'False'")
251  Config.get().distributed_memory = _distributed_memory
252  self._type = get_api(api)
253 
254  def create(self, invoke_info):
255  '''
256  Create the API-specific PSy instance.
257 
258  :param invoke_info: information on the invoke()s found by parsing
259  the Algorithm layer.
260  :type invoke_info: :py:class:`psyclone.parse.FileInfo`
261 
262  :returns: an instance of the API-specifc sub-class of PSy.
263  :rtype: subclass of :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.PSy`
264  '''
265  if self._type == "dynamo0.1":
266  from psyclone.dynamo0p1 import DynamoPSy as PSyClass
267  elif self._type == "dynamo0.3":
268  from psyclone.dynamo0p3 import DynamoPSy as PSyClass
269  elif self._type == "gocean0.1":
270  from psyclone.gocean0p1 import GOPSy as PSyClass
271  elif self._type == "gocean1.0":
272  from psyclone.gocean1p0 import GOPSy as PSyClass
273  elif self._type == "nemo":
274  from psyclone.nemo import NemoPSy as PSyClass
275  # For this API, the 'invoke_info' is actually the fparser2 AST
276  # of the Fortran file being processed
277  else:
278  raise GenerationError("PSyFactory: Internal Error: Unsupported "
279  "api type '{0}' found. Should not be "
280  "possible.".format(self._type))
281  return PSyClass(invoke_info)

284 class PSy(object):
285  '''
286  Base class to help manage and generate PSy code for a single
287  algorithm file. Takes the invocation information output from the
288  function :func:`parse.parse` as its input and stores this in a
289  way suitable for optimisation and code generation.
290 
291  :param FileInfo invoke_info: An object containing the required \
292  invocation information for code \
293  optimisation and generation. Produced \
294  by the function :func:`parse.parse`.
295  :type invoke_info: :py:class:`psyclone.parse.FileInfo`
296 
297  For example:
298 
299  >>> import psyclone
300  >>> from psyclone.parse import parse
301  >>> ast, info = parse("argspec.F90")
302  >>> from psyclone.psyGen import PSyFactory
303  >>> api = "..."
304  >>> psy = PSyFactory(api).create(info)
305  >>> print(psy.gen)
306 
307  '''
308  def __init__(self, invoke_info):
309  self._name = invoke_info.name
310  self._invokes = None
311 
312  def __str__(self):
313  return "PSy"
314 
315  @property
316  def invokes(self):
317  return self._invokes
318 
319  @property
320  def name(self):
321  return "psy_"+self._name
322 
323  @property
324  def gen(self):
325  raise NotImplementedError("Error: PSy.gen() must be implemented "
326  "by subclass")
327 
328  def inline(self, module):
329  ''' inline all kernel subroutines into the module that are marked for
330  inlining. Avoid inlining the same kernel more than once. '''
331  inlined_kernel_names = []
332  for invoke in self.invokes.invoke_list:
333  schedule = invoke.schedule
334  for kernel in schedule.walk(schedule.children, Kern):
335  if kernel.module_inline:
336  if kernel.name.lower() not in inlined_kernel_names:
337  inlined_kernel_names.append(kernel.name.lower())
338  module.add_raw_subroutine(kernel._kernel_code)
339

341 class Invokes(object):
342  ''' Manage the invoke calls '''
343  def __init__(self, alg_calls, Invoke):
344  self.invoke_map = {}
345  self.invoke_list = []
346  from psyclone.profiler import Profiler
347  for idx, alg_invocation in enumerate(alg_calls.values()):
348  my_invoke = Invoke(alg_invocation, idx)
349  self.invoke_map[my_invoke.name] = my_invoke
350  self.invoke_list.append(my_invoke)
351  # Add profiling nodes to schedule if automatic profiling has been
352  # requested.
353  Profiler.add_profile_nodes(my_invoke.schedule, Loop)
354 
355  def __str__(self):
356  return "Invokes object containing "+str(self.names)
357 
358  @property
359  def names(self):
360  return self.invoke_map.keys()
361 
362  def get(self, invoke_name):
363  # add a try here for keyerror
364  try:
365  return self.invoke_map[invoke_name]
366  except KeyError:
367  raise RuntimeError("Cannot find an invoke named '{0}' in {1}".
368  format(invoke_name,
369  str(self.names)))
370 
371  def gen_code(self, parent):
372  '''
373  Create the f2pygen AST for each Invoke in the PSy layer.
374 
375  :param parent: the parent node in the AST to which to add content.
376  :type parent: `psyclone.f2pygen.ModuleGen`
377  '''
378  opencl_kernels = []
379  for invoke in self.invoke_list:
380  invoke.gen_code(parent)
381  # If we are generating OpenCL for an Invoke then we need to
382  # create routine(s) to set the arguments of the Kernel(s) it
383  # calls. We do it here as this enables us to prevent
384  # duplication.
385  if invoke.schedule.opencl:
386  for kern in invoke.schedule.kern_calls():
387  if kern.name not in opencl_kernels:
388  opencl_kernels.append(kern.name)
389  kern.gen_arg_setter_code(parent)
390  # We must also ensure that we have a kernel object for
391  # each kernel called from the PSy layer
392  self.gen_ocl_init(parent, opencl_kernels)
393 
394  @staticmethod
395  def gen_ocl_init(parent, kernels):
396  '''
397  Generates a subroutine to initialise the OpenCL environment and
398  construct the list of OpenCL kernel objects used by this PSy layer.
399 
400  :param parent: the node in the f2pygen AST representing the module \
401  that will contain the generated subroutine.
402  :type parent: :py:class:`psyclone.f2pygen.ModuleGen`
403  :param kernels: List of kernel names called by the PSy layer.
404  :type kernels: list of str
405  '''
406  from psyclone.f2pygen import SubroutineGen, DeclGen, AssignGen, \
407  CallGen, UseGen, CommentGen, CharDeclGen, IfThenGen
408 
409  sub = SubroutineGen(parent, "psy_init")
410  parent.add(sub)
411  sub.add(UseGen(sub, name="fortcl", only=True,
412  funcnames=["ocl_env_init", "add_kernels"]))
413  # Add a logical variable used to ensure that this routine is only
414  # executed once.
415  sub.add(DeclGen(sub, datatype="logical", save=True,
416  entity_decls=["initialised"],
417  initial_values=[".False."]))
418  # Check whether or not this is our first time in the routine
419  sub.add(CommentGen(sub, " Check to make sure we only execute this "
420  "routine once"))
421  ifthen = IfThenGen(sub, ".not. initialised")
422  sub.add(ifthen)
423  ifthen.add(AssignGen(ifthen, lhs="initialised", rhs=".True."))
424 
425  # Initialise the OpenCL environment
426  ifthen.add(CommentGen(ifthen,
427  " Initialise the OpenCL environment/device"))
428  ifthen.add(CallGen(ifthen, "ocl_env_init"))
429 
430  # Create a list of our kernels
431  ifthen.add(CommentGen(ifthen,
432  " The kernels this PSy layer module requires"))
433  nkernstr = str(len(kernels))
434 
435  # Declare array of character strings
436  ifthen.add(CharDeclGen(
437  ifthen, length="30",
438  entity_decls=["kernel_names({0})".format(nkernstr)]))
439  for idx, kern in enumerate(kernels):
440  ifthen.add(AssignGen(ifthen, lhs="kernel_names({0})".format(idx+1),
441  rhs='"{0}"'.format(kern)))
442  ifthen.add(CommentGen(ifthen,
443  " Create the OpenCL kernel objects. Expects "
444  "to find all of the compiled"))
445  ifthen.add(CommentGen(ifthen, " kernels in PSYCLONE_KERNELS_FILE."))
446  ifthen.add(CallGen(ifthen, "add_kernels", [nkernstr, "kernel_names"]))
447

449 class NameSpaceFactory(object):
450  # storage for the instance reference
451  _instance = None
452 
453  def __init__(self, reset=False):
454  """ Create singleton instance """
455  # Check whether we already have an instance
456  if NameSpaceFactory._instance is None or reset:
457  # Create and remember instance
458  NameSpaceFactory._instance = NameSpace()
459 
460  def create(self):
461  return NameSpaceFactory._instance

463 
464 class NameSpace(object):
465  '''keeps a record of reserved names and used names for clashes and
466  provides a new name if there is a clash. '''
467 
468  def __init__(self, case_sensitive=False):
469  self._reserved_names = []
470  self._added_names = []
471  self._context = {}
472  self._case_sensitive = case_sensitive
473 
474  def create_name(self, root_name=None, context=None, label=None):
475  '''Returns a unique name. If root_name is supplied, the name returned
476  is based on this name, otherwise one is made up. If
477  context and label are supplied and a previous create_name
478  has been called with the same context and label then the
479  name provided by the previous create_name is returned.
480  '''
481  # make up a base name if one has not been supplied
482  if root_name is None:
483  root_name = "anon"
484  # if not case sensitive then make the name lower case
485  if not self._case_sensitive:
486  lname = root_name.lower()
487  else:
488  lname = root_name
489  # check context and label validity
490  if context is None and label is not None or \
491  context is not None and label is None:
492  raise RuntimeError(
493  "NameSpace:create_name() requires both context and label to "
494  "be set")
495 
496  # if the same context and label have already been supplied
497  # then return the previous name
498  if context is not None and label is not None:
499  # labels may have spurious white space
500  label = label.strip()
501  if not self._case_sensitive:
502  label = label.lower()
503  context = context.lower()
504  if context in self._context:
505  if label in self._context[context]:
506  # context and label have already been supplied
507  return self._context[context][label]
508  else:
509  # initialise the context so we can add the label value later
510  self._context[context] = {}
511 
512  # create our name
513  if lname not in self._reserved_names and \
514  lname not in self._added_names:
515  proposed_name = lname
516  else:
517  count = 1
518  proposed_name = lname + "_" + str(count)
519  while proposed_name in self._reserved_names or \
520  proposed_name in self._added_names:
521  count += 1
522  proposed_name = lname+"_"+str(count)
523 
524  # store our name
525  self._added_names.append(proposed_name)
526  if context is not None and label is not None:
527  self._context[context][label] = proposed_name
528 
529  return proposed_name
530 
531  def add_reserved_name(self, name):
532  ''' adds a reserved name. create_name() will not return this name '''
533  if not self._case_sensitive:
534  lname = name.lower()
535  else:
536  lname = name
537  # silently ignore if this is already a reserved name
538  if lname not in self._reserved_names:
539  if lname in self._added_names:
540  raise RuntimeError(
541  "attempted to add a reserved name to a namespace that"
542  " has already used that name")
543  self._reserved_names.append(lname)
544 
545  def add_reserved_names(self, names):
546  ''' adds a list of reserved names '''
547  for name in names:
548  self.add_reserved_name(name)
549 
550 
551 class Invoke(object):
552  ''' Manage an individual invoke call '''
553 
554  def __str__(self):
555  return self._name+"("+", ".join([str(arg) for arg in
556  self._alg_unique_args])+")"
557 
558  def __init__(self, alg_invocation, idx, schedule_class,
559  reserved_names=None):
560  '''Constructs an invoke object. Parameters:
561 
562  :param alg_invocation:
563  :type alg_invocation:
564  :param idx: Position/index of this invoke call in the subroutine.
565  If not None, this number is added to the name ("invoke_").
566  :type idx: Integer.
567  :param schedule_class: The schedule class to create for this invoke.
568  :type schedule_class: Schedule class.
569  :param reserved_names: Optional argument: list of reserved names,
570  i.e. names that should not be used e.g. as psyclone created
571  variable name.
572  :type reserved_names: List of strings.
573  '''
574 
575  self._name = "invoke"
576  self._alg_unique_args = []
577 
578  if alg_invocation is None and idx is None:
579  return
580 
581  # create a name for the call if one does not already exist
582  if alg_invocation.name is not None:
583  self._name = alg_invocation.name
584  elif len(alg_invocation.kcalls) == 1 and \
585  alg_invocation.kcalls[0].type == "kernelCall":
586  # use the name of the kernel call with the position appended.
587  # Appended position is needed in case we have two separate invokes
588  # in the same algorithm code containing the same (single) kernel
589  self._name = "invoke_" + str(idx) + "_" + \
590  alg_invocation.kcalls[0].ktype.name
591  else:
592  # use the position of the invoke
593  self._name = "invoke_"+str(idx)
594 
595  # create our namespace manager - must be done before creating the
596  # schedule
597  self._name_space_manager = NameSpaceFactory(reset=True).create()
598 
599  # Add the name for the call to the list of reserved names. This
600  # ensures we don't get a name clash with any variables we subsequently
601  # generate.
602  if reserved_names:
603  reserved_names.append(self._name)
604  else:
605  reserved_names = [self._name]
606  self._name_space_manager.add_reserved_names(reserved_names)
607 
608  # create the schedule
609  self._schedule = schedule_class(alg_invocation.kcalls)
610 
611  # let the schedule have access to me
612  self._schedule.invoke = self
613 
614  # extract the argument list for the algorithm call and psy
615  # layer subroutine.
616  self._alg_unique_args = []
617  self._psy_unique_vars = []
618  tmp_arg_names = []
619  for call in self.schedule.calls():
620  for arg in call.arguments.args:
621  if arg.text is not None:
622  if arg.text not in self._alg_unique_args:
623  self._alg_unique_args.append(arg.text)
624  if arg.name not in tmp_arg_names:
625  tmp_arg_names.append(arg.name)
626  self._psy_unique_vars.append(arg)
627  else:
628  # literals have no name
629  pass
630 
631  # work out the unique dofs required in this subroutine
632  self._dofs = {}
633  for kern_call in self._schedule.kern_calls():
634  dofs = kern_call.arguments.dofs
635  for dof in dofs:
636  if dof not in self._dofs:
637  # Only keep the first occurence for the moment. We will
638  # need to change this logic at some point as we need to
639  # cope with writes determining the dofs that are used.
640  self._dofs[dof] = [kern_call, dofs[dof][0]]
641 
642  @property
643  def name(self):
644  return self._name
645 
646  @property
647  def alg_unique_args(self):
648  return self._alg_unique_args
649 
650  @property
651  def psy_unique_vars(self):
652  return self._psy_unique_vars
653 
654  @property
655  def psy_unique_var_names(self):
656  names = []
657  for var in self._psy_unique_vars:
658  names.append(var.name)
659  return names
660 
661  @property
662  def schedule(self):
663  return self._schedule
664 
665  @schedule.setter
666  def schedule(self, obj):
667  self._schedule = obj
668 
669  def unique_declarations(self, datatype, access=None):
670  ''' Returns a list of all required declarations for the
671  specified datatype. If access is supplied (e.g. "gh_write") then
672  only declarations with that access are returned. '''
673  if datatype not in VALID_ARG_TYPE_NAMES:
674  raise GenerationError(
675  "unique_declarations called with an invalid datatype. "
676  "Expected one of '{0}' but found '{1}'".
677  format(str(VALID_ARG_TYPE_NAMES), datatype))
678  if access and access not in VALID_ACCESS_DESCRIPTOR_NAMES:
679  raise GenerationError(
680  "unique_declarations called with an invalid access type. "
681  "Expected one of '{0}' but got '{1}'".
682  format(VALID_ACCESS_DESCRIPTOR_NAMES, access))
683  declarations = []
684  for call in self.schedule.calls():
685  for arg in call.arguments.args:
686  if not access or arg.access == access:
687  if arg.text is not None:
688  if arg.type == datatype:
689  test_name = arg.declaration_name
690  if test_name not in declarations:
691  declarations.append(test_name)
692  return declarations
693 
694  def first_access(self, arg_name):
695  ''' Returns the first argument with the specified name passed to
696  a kernel in our schedule '''
697  for call in self.schedule.calls():
698  for arg in call.arguments.args:
699  if arg.text is not None:
700  if arg.declaration_name == arg_name:
701  return arg
702  raise GenerationError("Failed to find any kernel argument with name "
703  "'{0}'".format(arg_name))
704 
705  def unique_declns_by_intent(self, datatype):
706  '''
707  Returns a dictionary listing all required declarations for each
708  type of intent ('inout', 'out' and 'in').
709 
710  :param string datatype: the type of the kernel argument for the
711  particular API for which the intent is
712  required
713  :return: dictionary containing 'intent' keys holding the kernel
714  argument intent and declarations of all kernel arguments
715  for each type of intent
716  :rtype: dict
717  :raises GenerationError: if the kernel argument is not a valid
718  datatype for the particular API.
719 
720  '''
721  if datatype not in VALID_ARG_TYPE_NAMES:
722  raise GenerationError(
723  "unique_declns_by_intent called with an invalid datatype. "
724  "Expected one of '{0}' but found '{1}'".
725  format(str(VALID_ARG_TYPE_NAMES), datatype))
726 
727  # Get the lists of all kernel arguments that are accessed as
728  # inc (shared update), write, read and readwrite (independent
729  # update). A single argument may be accessed in different ways
730  # by different kernels.
731  inc_args = self.unique_declarations(datatype,
732  access=MAPPING_ACCESSES["inc"])
733  write_args = self.unique_declarations(datatype,
734  access=MAPPING_ACCESSES["write"])
735  read_args = self.unique_declarations(datatype,
736  access=MAPPING_ACCESSES["read"])
737  readwrite_args = self.unique_declarations(
738  datatype, access=MAPPING_ACCESSES["readwrite"])
739  sum_args = self.unique_declarations(datatype,
740  access=MAPPING_REDUCTIONS["sum"])
741  # sum_args behave as if they are write_args from
742  # the PSy-layer's perspective.
743  write_args += sum_args
744  # readwrite_args behave in the same way as inc_args
745  # from the perspective of first access and intents
746  inc_args += readwrite_args
747  # Rationalise our lists so that any fields that are updated
748  # (have inc or readwrite access) do not appear in the list
749  # of those that are only written to
750  for arg in write_args[:]:
751  if arg in inc_args:
752  write_args.remove(arg)
753  # Fields that are only ever read by any kernel that
754  # accesses them
755  for arg in read_args[:]:
756  if arg in write_args or arg in inc_args:
757  read_args.remove(arg)
758 
759  # We will return a dictionary containing as many lists
760  # as there are types of intent
761  declns = {}
762  for intent in FORTRAN_INTENT_NAMES:
763  declns[intent] = []
764 
765  for name in inc_args:
766  # For every arg that is updated ('inc'd' or readwritten)
767  # by at least one kernel, identify the type of the first
768  # access. If it is 'write' then the arg is only
769  # intent(out), otherwise it is intent(inout)
770  first_arg = self.first_access(name)
771  if first_arg.access != MAPPING_ACCESSES["write"]:
772  if name not in declns["inout"]:
773  declns["inout"].append(name)
774  else:
775  if name not in declns["out"]:
776  declns["out"].append(name)
777 
778  for name in write_args:
779  # For every argument that is written to by at least one kernel,
780  # identify the type of the first access - if it is read
781  # or inc'd before it is written then it must have intent(inout).
782  # However, we deal with inc and readwrite args separately so we
783  # do not consider those here.
784  first_arg = self.first_access(name)
785  if first_arg.access == MAPPING_ACCESSES["read"]:
786  if name not in declns["inout"]:
787  declns["inout"].append(name)
788  else:
789  if name not in declns["out"]:
790  declns["out"].append(name)
791 
792  for name in read_args:
793  # Anything we have left must be declared as intent(in)
794  if name not in declns["in"]:
795  declns["in"].append(name)
796 
797  return declns
798 
799  def gen(self):
800  from psyclone.f2pygen import ModuleGen
801  module = ModuleGen("container")
802  self.gen_code(module)
803  return module.root
804 
805  def gen_code(self, parent):
806  from psyclone.f2pygen import SubroutineGen, TypeDeclGen, DeclGen, \
807  SelectionGen, AssignGen
808  # create the subroutine
809  invoke_sub = SubroutineGen(parent, name=self.name,
810  args=self.psy_unique_vars)
811  # add the subroutine argument declarations
812  my_typedecl = TypeDeclGen(invoke_sub, datatype="field_type",
813  entity_decls=self.psy_unique_vars,
814  intent="inout")
815  invoke_sub.add(my_typedecl)
816  # declare field-type, column topology and function-space types
817  column_topology_name = "topology"
818  my_typedecl = TypeDeclGen(invoke_sub, datatype="ColumnTopology",
819  entity_decls=[column_topology_name],
820  pointer=True)
821  invoke_sub.add(my_typedecl)
822  # declare any basic types required
823  my_decl = DeclGen(invoke_sub, datatype="integer",
824  entity_decls=["nlayers"])
825  invoke_sub.add(my_decl)
826 
827  for (idx, dof) in enumerate(self._dofs):
828  call = self._dofs[dof][0]
829  arg = self._dofs[dof][1]
830  # declare a type select clause which is used to map from a base
831  # class to FunctionSpace_type
832  type_select = SelectionGen(invoke_sub,
833  expr=arg.name + "_space=>" + arg.name +
834  "%function_space", typeselect=True)
835  invoke_sub.add(type_select)
836 
837  my_typedecl = TypeDeclGen(invoke_sub,
838  datatype="FunctionSpace_type",
839  entity_decls=[arg.name+"_space"],
840  pointer=True)
841  invoke_sub.add(my_typedecl)
842 
843  content = []
844  if idx == 0:
845  # use the first model to provide nlayers
846  # *** assumption that all fields operate over the same number
847  # of layers
848  assign_1 = AssignGen(type_select, lhs="topology",
849  rhs=arg.name+"_space%topology",
850  pointer=True)
851  assign_2 = AssignGen(type_select, lhs="nlayers",
852  rhs="topology%layer_count()")
853  content.append(assign_1)
854  content.append(assign_2)
855  iterates_over = call.iterates_over
856  stencil = arg.stencil
857  assign_3 = AssignGen(type_select, lhs=dof+"dofmap",
858  rhs=arg.name +
859  "_space%dof_map(" + iterates_over + ", " +
860  stencil + ")",
861  pointer=True)
862  content.append(assign_3)
863  type_select.addcase(["FunctionSpace_type"], content=content)
864  # declare our dofmap
865  my_decl = DeclGen(invoke_sub, datatype="integer",
866  entity_decls=[dof+"dofmap(:,:)"], pointer=True)
867  invoke_sub.add(my_decl)
868 
869  # create the subroutine kernel call content
870  self.schedule.gen_code(invoke_sub)
871  parent.add(invoke_sub)
872 
873 
874 class Node(object):
875  '''
876  Base class for a node in the PSyIRe (schedule).
877 
878  :param children: the PSyIRe nodes that are children of this node.
879  :type children: :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node`
880  :param parent: that parent of this node in the PSyIRe tree.
881  :type parent: :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node`
882 
883  '''
884  def __init__(self, children=None, parent=None):
885  if not children:
886  self._children = []
887  else:
888  self._children = children
889  self._parent = parent
890  self._ast = None # Reference into fparser2 AST (if any)
891 
892  def __str__(self):
893  raise NotImplementedError("Please implement me")
894 
895  def dag(self, file_name='dag', file_format='svg'):
896  '''Create a dag of this node and its children'''
897  try:
898  import graphviz as gv
899  except ImportError:
900  # todo: add a warning to a log file here
901  # silently return if graphviz bindings are not installed
902  return
903  try:
904  graph = gv.Digraph(format=file_format)
905  except ValueError:
906  raise GenerationError(
907  "unsupported graphviz file format '{0}' provided".
908  format(file_format))
909  self.dag_gen(graph)
910  graph.render(filename=file_name)
911 
912  def dag_gen(self, graph):
913  '''output my node's graph (dag) information and call any
914  children. Nodes with children are represented as two vertices,
915  a start and an end. Forward dependencies are represented as
916  green edges, backward dependencies are represented as red
917  edges (but their direction is reversed so the layout looks
918  reasonable) and parent child dependencies are represented as
919  blue edges.'''
920  # names to append to my default name to create start and end vertices
921  start_postfix = "_start"
922  end_postfix = "_end"
923  if self.children:
924  # I am represented by two vertices, a start and an end
925  graph.node(self.dag_name+start_postfix)
926  graph.node(self.dag_name+end_postfix)
927  else:
928  # I am represented by a single vertex
929  graph.node(self.dag_name)
930  # first deal with forward dependencies
931  remote_node = self.forward_dependence()
932  local_name = self.dag_name
933  if self.children:
934  # edge will come from my end vertex as I am a forward dependence
935  local_name += end_postfix
936  if remote_node:
937  # this node has a forward dependence
938  remote_name = remote_node.dag_name
939  if remote_node.children:
940  # the remote node has children so I will connect to
941  # its start vertex
942  remote_name += start_postfix
943  # Create the forward dependence edge in green
944  graph.edge(local_name, remote_name, color="green")
945  elif self.parent:
946  # this node is a child of another node and has no forward
947  # dependence. Therefore connect it to the the end vertex
948  # of its parent. Use blue to indicate a parent child
949  # relationship.
950  remote_name = self.parent.dag_name + end_postfix
951  graph.edge(local_name, remote_name, color="blue")
952  # now deal with backward dependencies. When creating the edges
953  # we reverse the direction of the dependence (place
954  # remote_node before local_node) to help with the graph
955  # layout
956  remote_node = self.backward_dependence()
957  local_name = self.dag_name
958  if self.children:
959  # the edge will come from my start vertex as I am a
960  # backward dependence
961  local_name += start_postfix
962  if remote_node:
963  # this node has a backward dependence.
964  remote_name = remote_node.dag_name
965  if remote_node.children:
966  # the remote node has children so I will connect to
967  # its end vertex
968  remote_name += end_postfix
969  # Create the backward dependence edge in red.
970  graph.edge(remote_name, local_name, color="red")
971  elif self.parent:
972  # this node has a parent and has no backward
973  # dependence. Therefore connect it to the the start vertex
974  # of its parent. Use blue to indicate a parent child
975  # relationship.
976  remote_name = self.parent.dag_name + start_postfix
977  graph.edge(remote_name, local_name, color="blue")
978  # now call any children so they can add their information to
979  # the graph
980  for child in self.children:
981  child.dag_gen(graph)
982 
983  @property
984  def dag_name(self):
985  ''' return the base dag name for this node '''
986  return "node_" + str(self.abs_position)
987 
988  @property
989  def args(self):
990  '''Return the list of arguments associated with this node. The default
991  implementation assumes the node has no directly associated
992  arguments (i.e. is not a Call class or subclass). Arguments of
993  any of this nodes descendents are considered to be
994  associated. '''
995  args = []
996  for call in self.calls():
997  args.extend(call.args)
998  return args
999 
1000  def backward_dependence(self):
1001  '''Returns the closest preceding Node that this Node has a direct
1002  dependence with or None if there is not one. Only Nodes with
1003  the same parent as self are returned. Nodes inherit their
1004  descendents dependencies. The reason for this is that for
1005  correctness a node must maintain its parent if it is
1006  moved. For example a halo exchange and a kernel call may have
1007  a dependence between them but it is the loop body containing
1008  the kernel call that the halo exchange must not move beyond
1009  i.e. the loop body inherits the dependencies of the routines
1010  within it.'''
1011  dependence = None
1012  # look through all the backward dependencies of my arguments
1013  for arg in self.args:
1014  dependent_arg = arg.backward_dependence()
1015  if dependent_arg:
1016  # this argument has a backward dependence
1017  node = dependent_arg.call
1018  # if the remote node is deeper in the tree than me
1019  # then find the ancestor that is at the same level of
1020  # the tree as me.
1021  while node.depth > self.depth:
1022  node = node.parent
1023  if self.sameParent(node):
1024  # The remote node (or one of its ancestors) shares
1025  # the same parent as me
1026  if not dependence:
1027  # this is the first dependence found so keep it
1028  dependence = node
1029  else:
1030  # we have already found a dependence
1031  if dependence.position < node.position:
1032  # the new dependence is closer to me than
1033  # the previous dependence so keep it
1034  dependence = node
1035  return dependence
1036 
1037  def forward_dependence(self):
1038  '''Returns the closest following Node that this Node has a direct
1039  dependence with or None if there is not one. Only Nodes with
1040  the same parent as self are returned. Nodes inherit their
1041  descendents dependencies. The reason for this is that for
1042  correctness a node must maintain its parent if it is
1043  moved. For example a halo exchange and a kernel call may have
1044  a dependence between them but it is the loop body containing
1045  the kernel call that the halo exchange must not move beyond
1046  i.e. the loop body inherits the dependencies of the routines
1047  within it.'''
1048  dependence = None
1049  # look through all the forward dependencies of my arguments
1050  for arg in self.args:
1051  dependent_arg = arg.forward_dependence()
1052  if dependent_arg:
1053  # this argument has a forward dependence
1054  node = dependent_arg.call
1055  # if the remote node is deeper in the tree than me
1056  # then find the ancestor that is at the same level of
1057  # the tree as me.
1058  while node.depth > self.depth:
1059  node = node.parent
1060  if self.sameParent(node):
1061  # The remote node (or one of its ancestors) shares
1062  # the same parent as me
1063  if not dependence:
1064  # this is the first dependence found so keep it
1065  dependence = node
1066  else:
1067  if dependence.position > node.position:
1068  # the new dependence is closer to me than
1069  # the previous dependence so keep it
1070  dependence = node
1071  return dependence
1072 
1073  def is_valid_location(self, new_node, position="before"):
1074  '''If this Node can be moved to the new_node
1075  (where position determines whether it is before of after the
1076  new_node) without breaking any data dependencies then return True,
1077  otherwise return False. '''
1078  # First perform correctness checks
1079  # 1: check new_node is a Node
1080  if not isinstance(new_node, Node):
1081  raise GenerationError(
1082  "In the psyGen Call class is_valid_location() method the "
1083  "supplied argument is not a Node, it is a '{0}'.".
1084  format(type(new_node).__name__))
1085 
1086  # 2: check position has a valid value
1087  valid_positions = ["before", "after"]
1088  if position not in valid_positions:
1089  raise GenerationError(
1090  "The position argument in the psyGen Call class "
1091  "is_valid_location() method must be one of {0} but "
1092  "found '{1}'".format(valid_positions, position))
1093 
1094  # 3: check self and new_node have the same parent
1095  if not self.sameParent(new_node):
1096  raise GenerationError(
1097  "In the psyGen Call class is_valid_location() method "
1098  "the node and the location do not have the same parent")
1099 
1100  # 4: check proposed new position is not the same as current position
1101  new_position = new_node.position
1102  if new_position < self.position and position == "after":
1103  new_position += 1
1104  elif new_position > self.position and position == "before":
1105  new_position -= 1
1106 
1107  if self.position == new_position:
1108  raise GenerationError(
1109  "In the psyGen Call class is_valid_location() method, the "
1110  "node and the location are the same so this transformation "
1111  "would have no effect.")
1112 
1113  # Now determine whether the new location is valid in terms of
1114  # data dependencies
1115  # Treat forward and backward dependencies separately
1116  if new_position < self.position:
1117  # the new_node is before this node in the schedule
1118  prev_dep_node = self.backward_dependence()
1119  if not prev_dep_node:
1120  # There are no backward dependencies so the move is valid
1121  return True
1122  else:
1123  # return (is the dependent node before the new_position?)
1124  return prev_dep_node.position < new_position
1125  else: # new_node.position > self.position
1126  # the new_node is after this node in the schedule
1127  next_dep_node = self.forward_dependence()
1128  if not next_dep_node:
1129  # There are no forward dependencies so the move is valid
1130  return True
1131  else:
1132  # return (is the dependent node after the new_position?)
1133  return next_dep_node.position > new_position
1134 
1135  @property
1136  def depth(self):
1137  ''' Returns this Node's depth in the tree. '''
1138  my_depth = 0
1139  node = self
1140  while node is not None:
1141  node = node.parent
1142  my_depth += 1
1143  return my_depth

1146  raise NotImplementedError("BaseClass of a Node must implement the "
1147  "view method")

1149  def indent(self, count, indent=" "):
1150  result = ""
1151  for i in range(count):
1152  result += indent
1153  return result

1155  def list(self, indent=0):
1156  result = ""
1157  for entity in self._children:
1158  result += str(entity)+"\n"
1159  return result

1161  def list_to_string(self, my_list):
1162  result = ""
1163  for idx, value in enumerate(my_list):
1164  result += str(value)
1165  if idx < (len(my_list) - 1):
1166  result += ","
1167  return result

1169  def addchild(self, child, index=None):
1170  if index is not None:
1171  self._children.insert(index, child)
1172  else:
1173  self._children.append(child)

1175  @property
1176  def children(self):
1177  return self._children
1178

1180  def children(self, my_children):
1181  self._children = my_children

1184  def parent(self):
1185  return self._parent

1189  self._parent = my_parent

1191  @property
1192  def position(self):
1193  if self.parent is None:
1194  return 0
1195  return self.parent.children.index(self)
1196 
1197  @property
1198  def abs_position(self):
1199  ''' Find my position in the schedule. Needs to be computed
1200  dynamically as my position may change. '''
1201 
1202  if self.root == self:
1203  return 0
1204  found, position = self._find_position(self.root.children, 0)
1205  if not found:
1206  raise Exception("Error in search for my position in "
1207  "the tree")
1208  return position
1209 
1210  def _find_position(self, children, position):
1211  ''' Recurse through the tree depth first returning position if
1212  found.'''
1213  for child in children:
1214  position += 1
1215  if child == self:
1216  return True, position
1217  if child.children:
1218  found, position = self._find_position(child.children, position)
1219  if found:
1220  return True, position
1221  return False, position
1222 
1223  @property
1224  def root(self):
1225  node = self
1226  while node.parent is not None:
1227  node = node.parent
1228  return node
1229 
1230  def sameRoot(self, node_2):
1231  if self.root == node_2.root:
1232  return True
1233  return False
1234 
1235  def sameParent(self, node_2):
1236  if self.parent is None or node_2.parent is None:
1237  return False
1238  if self.parent == node_2.parent:
1239  return True
1240  return False
1241 
1242  def walk(self, children, my_type):
1243  ''' recurse through tree and return objects of mytype '''
1244  local_list = []
1245  for child in children:
1246  if isinstance(child, my_type):
1247  local_list.append(child)
1248  local_list += self.walk(child.children, my_type)
1249  return local_list
1250 
1251  def ancestor(self, my_type, excluding=None):
1252  '''
1253  Search back up tree and check whether we have an ancestor that is
1254  an instance of the supplied type. If we do then we return
1255  it otherwise we return None. A list of (sub-) classes to ignore
1256  may be provided via the `excluding` argument.
1257 
1258  :param type my_type: Class to search for.
1259  :param list excluding: list of (sub-)classes to ignore or None.
1260  :returns: First ancestor Node that is an instance of the requested \
1261  class or None if not found.
1262  '''
1263  myparent = self.parent
1264  while myparent is not None:
1265  if isinstance(myparent, my_type):
1266  matched = True
1267  if excluding:
1268  # We have one or more sub-classes we must exclude
1269  for etype in excluding:
1270  if isinstance(myparent, etype):
1271  matched = False
1272  break
1273  if matched:
1274  return myparent
1275  myparent = myparent.parent
1276  return None
1277 
1278  def calls(self):
1279  ''' return all calls that are descendents of this node '''
1280  return self.walk(self.children, Call)
1281 
1282  def following(self):
1283  '''Return all :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node` nodes after me in the
1284  schedule. Ordering is depth first.
1285 
1286  :return: a list of nodes
1287  :rtype: :func:`list` of :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node`
1288 
1289  '''
1290  all_nodes = self.walk(self.root.children, Node)
1291  position = all_nodes.index(self)
1292  return all_nodes[position+1:]
1293 
1294  def preceding(self, reverse=None):
1295  '''Return all :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node` nodes before me in the
1296  schedule. Ordering is depth first. If the `reverse` argument
1297  is set to `True` then the node ordering is reversed
1298  i.e. returning the nodes closest to me first
1299 
1300  :param: reverse: An optional, default `False`, boolean flag
1301  :type: reverse: bool
1302  :return: A list of nodes
1303  :rtype: :func:`list` of :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node`
1304 
1305  '''
1306  all_nodes = self.walk(self.root.children, Node)
1307  position = all_nodes.index(self)
1308  nodes = all_nodes[:position]
1309  if reverse:
1310  nodes.reverse()
1311  return nodes
1312 
1313  @property
1314  def following_calls(self):
1315  ''' return all calls after me in the schedule '''
1316  all_calls = self.root.calls()
1317  position = all_calls.index(self)
1318  return all_calls[position+1:]
1319 
1320  @property
1321  def preceding_calls(self):
1322  ''' return all calls before me in the schedule '''
1323  all_calls = self.root.calls()
1324  position = all_calls.index(self)
1325  return all_calls[:position-1]
1326 
1327  def kern_calls(self):
1328  '''return all user-supplied kernel calls in this schedule'''
1329  return self.walk(self._children, Kern)
1330 
1331  def loops(self):
1332  ''' return all loops currently in this schedule '''
1333  return self.walk(self._children, Loop)
1334 
1335  def reductions(self, reprod=None):
1336  '''Return all calls that have reductions and are decendents of this
1337  node. If reprod is not provided, all reductions are
1338  returned. If reprod is False, all builtin reductions that are
1339  not set to reproducible are returned. If reprod is True, all
1340  builtins that are set to reproducible are returned.'''
1341 
1342  call_reduction_list = []
1343  for call in self.walk(self.children, Call):
1344  if call.is_reduction:
1345  if reprod is None:
1346  call_reduction_list.append(call)
1347  elif reprod:
1348  if call.reprod_reduction:
1349  call_reduction_list.append(call)
1350  else:
1351  if not call.reprod_reduction:
1352  call_reduction_list.append(call)
1353  return call_reduction_list
1354 
1355  def is_openmp_parallel(self):
1356  '''Returns true if this Node is within an OpenMP parallel region
1357 
1358  '''
1359  omp_dir = self.ancestor(OMPParallelDirective)
1360  if omp_dir:
1361  return True
1362  return False
1363 
1364  def gen_code(self):
1365  raise NotImplementedError("Please implement me")
1366 
1367  def update(self):
1368  ''' By default we assume there is no need to update the existing
1369  fparser2 AST which this Node represents. We simply call the update()
1370  method of any children. '''
1371  for child in self._children:
1372  child.update()

1374 
1375 class Schedule(Node):
1376  '''
1377  Stores schedule information for an invocation call. Schedules can be
1378  optimised using transformations.
1379 
1380  >>> from parse import parse
1381  >>> ast, info = parse("algorithm.f90")
1382  >>> from psyGen import PSyFactory
1383  >>> api = "..."
1384  >>> psy = PSyFactory(api).create(info)
1385  >>> invokes = psy.invokes
1386  >>> invokes.names
1387  >>> invoke = invokes.get("name")
1388  >>> schedule = invoke.schedule
1389  >>> schedule.view()
1390 
1391  :param type KernFactory: class instance of the factory to use when \
1392  creating Kernels. e.g. :py:class:`psyclone.dynamo0p3.DynKernCallFactory`.
1393  :param type BuiltInFactory: class instance of the factory to use when \
1394  creating built-ins. e.g. \
1395  :py:class:`psyclone.dynamo0p3_builtins.DynBuiltInCallFactory`.
1396  :param alg_calls: list of Kernel calls in the schedule.
1397  :type alg_calls: list of :py:class:`psyclone.parse.KernelCall`
1398 
1399  '''
1400  def __init__(self, KernFactory, BuiltInFactory, alg_calls=None):
1401  # we need to separate calls into loops (an iteration space really)
1402  # and calls so that we can perform optimisations separately on the
1403  # two entities.
1404  sequence = []
1405  from psyclone.parse import BuiltInCall
1406  if alg_calls:
1407  for call in alg_calls:
1408  if isinstance(call, BuiltInCall):
1409  sequence.append(BuiltInFactory.create(call, parent=self))
1410  else:
1411  sequence.append(KernFactory.create(call, parent=self))
1412  Node.__init__(self, children=sequence)
1413  self._invoke = None
1414  self._opencl = False # Whether or not to generate OpenCL
1415  self._name_space_manager = NameSpaceFactory().create()
1416 
1417  @property
1418  def dag_name(self):
1419  ''' Return the name to use in a dag for this node'''
1420  return "schedule"
1421 
1422  def tkinter_delete(self):
1423  for entity in self._children:
1424  entity.tkinter_delete()
1425 
1426  def tkinter_display(self, canvas, x, y):
1427  y_offset = 0
1428  for entity in self._children:
1429  entity.tkinter_display(canvas, x, y+y_offset)
1430  y_offset = y_offset+entity.height
1431 
1432  @property
1433  def invoke(self):
1434  return self._invoke
1435 
1436  @invoke.setter
1437  def invoke(self, my_invoke):
1438  self._invoke = my_invoke
1439 
1440  def view(self, indent=0):
1441  '''
1442  Print a text representation of this node to stdout and then
1443  call the view() method of any children.
1444 
1445  :param indent: Depth of indent for output text
1446  :type indent: integer
1447  '''
1448  print(self.indent(indent) + self.coloured_text +
1449  "[invoke='" + self.invoke.name + "']")
1450  for entity in self._children:
1451  entity.view(indent=indent + 1)
1452 
1453  @property
1454  def coloured_text(self):
1455  '''
1456  Returns the name of this node with appropriate control codes
1457  to generate coloured output in a terminal that supports it.
1458 
1459  :return: Text containing the name of this node, possibly coloured
1460  :rtype: string
1461  '''
1462  return colored("Schedule", SCHEDULE_COLOUR_MAP["Schedule"])
1463 
1464  def __str__(self):
1465  result = "Schedule:\n"
1466  for entity in self._children:
1467  result += str(entity)+"\n"
1468  result += "End Schedule"
1469  return result
1470 
1471  def gen_code(self, parent):
1472  '''
1473  Generate the Nodes in the f2pygen AST for this schedule.
1474 
1475  :param parent: the parent Node (i.e. the enclosing subroutine) to \
1476  which to add content.
1477  :type parent: :py:class:`psyclone.f2pygen.SubroutineGen`
1478  '''
1479  from psyclone.f2pygen import UseGen, DeclGen, AssignGen, CommentGen, \
1480  IfThenGen, CallGen
1481 
1482  if self._opencl:
1483  parent.add(UseGen(parent, name="iso_c_binding"))
1484  parent.add(UseGen(parent, name="clfortran"))
1485  parent.add(UseGen(parent, name="fortcl", only=True,
1486  funcnames=["get_num_cmd_queues",
1487  "get_cmd_queues",
1488  "get_kernel_by_name"]))
1489  # Command queues
1490  nqueues = self._name_space_manager.create_name(
1491  root_name="num_cmd_queues", context="PSyVars",
1492  label="num_cmd_queues")
1493  qlist = self._name_space_manager.create_name(
1494  root_name="cmd_queues", context="PSyVars", label="cmd_queues")
1495  first = self._name_space_manager.create_name(
1496  root_name="first_time", context="PSyVars", label="first_time")
1497  flag = self._name_space_manager.create_name(
1498  root_name="ierr", context="PSyVars", label="ierr")
1499  parent.add(DeclGen(parent, datatype="integer", save=True,
1500  entity_decls=[nqueues]))
1501  parent.add(DeclGen(parent, datatype="integer", save=True,
1502  pointer=True, kind="c_intptr_t",
1503  entity_decls=[qlist + "(:)"]))
1504  parent.add(DeclGen(parent, datatype="integer",
1505  entity_decls=[flag]))
1506  parent.add(DeclGen(parent, datatype="logical", save=True,
1507  entity_decls=[first],
1508  initial_values=[".true."]))
1509  if_first = IfThenGen(parent, first)
1510  parent.add(if_first)
1511  if_first.add(AssignGen(if_first, lhs=first, rhs=".false."))
1512  if_first.add(CommentGen(if_first,
1513  " Ensure OpenCL run-time is initialised "
1514  "for this PSy-layer module"))
1515  if_first.add(CallGen(if_first, "psy_init"))
1516  if_first.add(AssignGen(if_first, lhs=nqueues,
1517  rhs="get_num_cmd_queues()"))
1518  if_first.add(AssignGen(if_first, lhs=qlist, pointer=True,
1519  rhs="get_cmd_queues()"))
1520  # Kernel pointers
1521  kernels = self.walk(self._children, Call)
1522  for kern in kernels:
1523  base = "kernel_" + kern.name
1524  kernel = self._name_space_manager.create_name(
1525  root_name=base, context="PSyVars", label=base)
1526  parent.add(
1527  DeclGen(parent, datatype="integer", kind="c_intptr_t",
1528  save=True, target=True, entity_decls=[kernel]))
1529  if_first.add(
1530  AssignGen(
1531  if_first, lhs=kernel,
1532  rhs='get_kernel_by_name("{0}")'.format(kern.name)))
1533 
1534  for entity in self._children:
1535  entity.gen_code(parent)
1536 
1537  if self.opencl:
1538  # Ensure we block at the end of the invoke to ensure all
1539  # kernels have completed before we return.
1540  # This code ASSUMES only the first command queue is used for
1541  # executing kernels.
1542  parent.add(CommentGen(parent,
1543  " Block until all kernels have finished"))
1544  parent.add(AssignGen(parent, lhs=flag,
1545  rhs="clFinish(" + qlist + "(1))"))
1546 
1547  @property
1548  def opencl(self):
1549  '''
1550  :return: Whether or not we are generating OpenCL for this Schedule.
1551  :rtype: bool
1552  '''
1553  return self._opencl
1554 
1555  @opencl.setter
1556  def opencl(self, value):
1557  '''
1558  Setter for whether or not to generate the OpenCL version of this
1559  schedule.
1560 
1561  :param bool value: whether or not to generate OpenCL.
1562  '''
1563  if not isinstance(value, bool):
1564  raise ValueError("Schedule.opencl must be a bool but got {0}".
1565  format(type(value)))
1566  self._opencl = value

1628 @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta)
1629 class ACCDataDirective(ACCDirective):
1630  '''
1631  Abstract class representing a "!$ACC enter data" OpenACC directive in
1632  a Schedule. Must be sub-classed for a particular API because the way
1633  in which fields are marked as being on the remote device is API-
1634  -dependent.
1635 
1636  :param children: list of nodes which this directive should \
1637  have as children.
1638  :type children: list of :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node`.
1639  :param parent: the node in the Schedule to which to add this \
1640  directive as a child.
1641  :type parent: :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node`.
1642  '''
1643  def __init__(self, children=None, parent=None):
1644  super(ACCDataDirective, self).__init__(children, parent)
1645  self._acc_dirs = None # List of parallel directives
1646 
1647  def view(self, indent=0):
1648  '''
1649  Print a text representation of this Node to stdout.
1650 
1651  :param int indent: the amount by which to indent the output.
1652  '''
1653  print(self.indent(indent)+self.coloured_text+"[ACC enter data]")
1654  for entity in self._children:
1655  entity.view(indent=indent + 1)
1656 
1657  @property
1658  def dag_name(self):
1659  '''
1660  :returns: the name to use for this Node in a DAG
1661  :rtype: str
1662  '''
1663  return "ACC_data_" + str(self.abs_position)
1664 
1665  def gen_code(self, parent):
1666  '''
1667  Generate the elements of the f2pygen AST for this Node in the Schedule.
1668 
1669  :param parent: node in the f2pygen AST to which to add node(s).
1670  :type parent: :py:class:`psyclone.f2pygen.BaseGen`
1671  '''
1672  from psyclone.f2pygen import DeclGen, DirectiveGen, CommentGen, \
1673  IfThenGen, AssignGen, CallGen, UseGen
1674 
1675  # We must generate a list of all of the fields accessed by
1676  # OpenACC kernels (calls within an OpenACC parallel directive)
1677  # 1. Find all parallel directives. We store this list for later
1678  # use in any sub-class.
1679  self._acc_dirs = self.walk(self.root.children, ACCParallelDirective)
1680  # 2. For each directive, loop over each of the fields used by
1681  # the kernels it contains (this list is given by var_list)
1682  # and add it to our list if we don't already have it
1683  var_list = []
1684  # TODO grid properties are effectively duplicated in this list (but
1685  # the OpenACC deep-copy support should spot this).
1686  for pdir in self._acc_dirs:
1687  for var in pdir.ref_list:
1688  if var not in var_list:
1689  var_list.append(var)
1690  # 3. Convert this list of objects into a comma-delimited string
1691  var_str = self.list_to_string(var_list)
1692 
1693  # 4. Declare and initialise a logical variable to keep track of
1694  # whether this is the first time we've entered this Invoke
1695  name_space_manager = NameSpaceFactory().create()
1696  first_time = name_space_manager.create_name(
1697  root_name="first_time", context="PSyVars", label="first_time")
1698  parent.add(DeclGen(parent, datatype="logical",
1699  entity_decls=[first_time],
1700  initial_values=[".True."],
1701  save=True))
1702  parent.add(CommentGen(parent,
1703  " Ensure all fields are on the device and"))
1704  parent.add(CommentGen(parent, " copy them over if not."))
1705  # 5. Put the enter data directive inside an if-block so that we
1706  # only ever do it once
1707  ifthen = IfThenGen(parent, first_time)
1708  parent.add(ifthen)
1709  ifthen.add(DirectiveGen(ifthen, "acc", "begin", "enter data",
1710  "copyin("+var_str+")"))
1711  # 6. Flag that we have now entered this routine at least once
1712  ifthen.add(AssignGen(ifthen, lhs=first_time, rhs=".false."))
1713  # 7. Flag that the data is now on the device. This calls down
1714  # into the API-specific subclass of this class.
1715  self.data_on_device(ifthen)
1716  parent.add(CommentGen(parent, ""))
1717 
1718  # 8. Ensure that any scalars are up-to-date
1719  var_list = []
1720  for pdir in self._acc_dirs:
1721  for var in pdir.scalars:
1722  if var not in var_list:
1723  var_list.append(var)
1724  if var_list:
1725  # We need to 'use' the openacc module in order to access
1726  # the OpenACC run-time library
1727  parent.add(UseGen(parent, name="openacc", only=True,
1728  funcnames=["acc_update_device"]))
1729  parent.add(
1730  CommentGen(parent,
1731  " Ensure all scalars on the device are up-to-date"))
1732  for var in var_list:
1733  parent.add(CallGen(parent, "acc_update_device", [var, "1"]))
1734  parent.add(CommentGen(parent, ""))
1735 
1736  @abc.abstractmethod
1737  def data_on_device(self, parent):
1738  '''
1739  Adds nodes into a Schedule to flag that the data required by the
1740  kernels in the data region is now on the device.
1741 
1742  :param parent: the node in the Schedule to which to add nodes
1743  :type parent: :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node`
1744  '''
1745 
1746 
1747 class ACCParallelDirective(ACCDirective):
1748  ''' Class for the !$ACC PARALLEL directive of OpenACC. '''
1749 
1750  def view(self, indent=0):
1751  '''
1752  Print a text representation of this Node to stdout.
1753 
1754  :param int indent: the amount by which to indent the output.
1755  '''
1756  print(self.indent(indent)+self.coloured_text+"[ACC Parallel]")
1757  for entity in self._children:
1758  entity.view(indent=indent + 1)
1759 
1760  @property
1761  def dag_name(self):
1762  '''
1763  :returns: the name to use for this Node in a DAG
1764  :rtype: str
1765  '''
1766  return "ACC_parallel_" + str(self.abs_position)
1767 
1768  def gen_code(self, parent):
1769  '''
1770  Generate the elements of the f2pygen AST for this Node in the Schedule.
1771 
1772  :param parent: node in the f2pygen AST to which to add node(s).
1773  :type parent: :py:class:`psyclone.f2pygen.BaseGen`
1774  '''
1775  from psyclone.f2pygen import DirectiveGen
1776 
1777  # Since we use "default(present)" the Schedule must contain an
1778  # 'enter data' directive. We don't mandate the order in which
1779  # transformations are applied so we have to check for that here.
1780  # We can't use Node.ancestor() because the data directive does
1781  # not have children. Instead, we go back up to the Schedule and
1782  # walk down from there.
1783  nodes = self.root.walk(self.root.children, ACCDataDirective)
1784  if len(nodes) != 1:
1785  raise GenerationError(
1786  "A Schedule containing an ACC parallel region must also "
1787  "contain an ACC enter data directive but none was found for "
1788  "{0}".format(self.root.invoke.name))
1789  # Check that the enter-data directive comes before this parallel
1790  # directive
1791  if nodes[0].abs_position > self.abs_position:
1792  raise GenerationError(
1793  "An ACC parallel region must be preceeded by an ACC enter-"
1794  "data directive but in {0} this is not the case.".
1795  format(self.root.invoke.name))
1796 
1797  # "default(present)" means that the compiler is to assume that
1798  # all data required by the parallel region is already present
1799  # on the device. If we've made a mistake and it isn't present
1800  # then we'll get a run-time error.
1801  parent.add(DirectiveGen(parent, "acc", "begin", "parallel",
1802  "default(present)"))
1803 
1804  for child in self.children:
1805  child.gen_code(parent)
1806 
1807  parent.add(DirectiveGen(parent, "acc", "end", "parallel", ""))
1808 
1809  @property
1810  def ref_list(self):
1811  '''
1812  Returns a list of the references (whether to arrays or objects)
1813  required by the Kernel call(s) that are children of this
1814  directive. This is the list of quantities that must be
1815  available on the remote device (probably a GPU) before
1816  the parallel region can be begun.
1817 
1818  :returns: list of variable names
1819  :rtype: list of str
1820  '''
1821  variables = []
1822 
1823  # Look-up the calls that are children of this node
1824  for call in self.calls():
1825  for arg in call.arguments.acc_args:
1826  if arg not in variables:
1827  variables.append(arg)
1828  return variables
1829 
1830  @property
1831  def fields(self):
1832  '''
1833  Returns a list of the names of field objects required by the Kernel
1834  call(s) that are children of this directive.
1835 
1836  :returns: list of names of field arguments.
1837  :rtype: list of str
1838  '''
1839  # Look-up the calls that are children of this node
1840  fld_list = []
1841  for call in self.calls():
1842  for arg in call.arguments.fields:
1843  if arg not in fld_list:
1844  fld_list.append(arg)
1845  return fld_list
1846 
1847  @property
1848  def scalars(self):
1849  '''
1850  Returns a list of the scalar quantities required by the Calls in
1851  this region.
1852 
1853  :returns: list of names of scalar arguments.
1854  :rtype: list of str
1855  '''
1856  scalars = []
1857  for call in self.calls():
1858  for arg in call.arguments.scalars:
1859  if arg not in scalars:
1860  scalars.append(arg)
1861  return scalars
1862 
1863 
1864 class ACCLoopDirective(ACCDirective):
1865  '''
1866  Class managing the creation of a '!$acc loop' OpenACC directive.
1867 
1868  :param children: list of nodes that will be children of this directive.
1869  :type children: list of :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node`.
1870  :param parent: the node in the Schedule to which to add this directive.
1871  :type parent: :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node`.
1872  :param int collapse: Number of nested loops to collapse into a single \
1873  iteration space or None.
1874  :param bool independent: Whether or not to add the `independent` clause \
1875  to the loop directive.
1876  '''
1877  def __init__(self, children=None, parent=None, collapse=None,
1878  independent=True):
1879  self._collapse = collapse
1880  self._independent = independent
1881  super(ACCLoopDirective, self).__init__(children, parent)
1882 
1883  @property
1884  def dag_name(self):
1885  '''
1886  :returns: the name to use for this Node in a DAG
1887  :rtype: str
1888  '''
1889  return "ACC_loop_" + str(self.abs_position)
1890 
1891  def view(self, indent=0):
1892  '''
1893  Print a textual representation of this Node to stdout.
1894 
1895  :param int indent: amount to indent output by
1896  '''
1897  text = self.indent(indent)+self.coloured_text+"[ACC Loop"
1898  if self._collapse:
1899  text += ", collapse={0}".format(self._collapse)
1900  if self._independent:
1901  text += ", independent"
1902  text += "]"
1903  print(text)
1904  for entity in self._children:
1905  entity.view(indent=indent + 1)
1906 
1907  def gen_code(self, parent):
1908  '''
1909  Generate the f2pygen AST entries in the Schedule for this OpenACC
1910  loop directive.
1911 
1912  :param parent: the parent Node in the Schedule to which to add our
1913  content.
1914  :type parent: sub-class of :py:class:`psyclone.f2pygen.BaseGen`
1915  :raises GenerationError: if this "!$acc loop" is not enclosed within \
1916  an ACC Parallel region.
1917  '''
1918  from psyclone.f2pygen import DirectiveGen
1919 
1920  # It is only at the point of code generation that we can check for
1921  # correctness (given that we don't mandate the order that a user can
1922  # apply transformations to the code). As an orphaned loop directive,
1923  # we must have an ACCParallelDirective as an ancestor somewhere
1924  # back up the tree.
1925  if not self.ancestor(ACCParallelDirective):
1926  raise GenerationError(
1927  "ACCLoopDirective must have an ACCParallelDirective as an "
1928  "ancestor in the Schedule")
1929 
1930  # Add any clauses to the directive
1931  options = []
1932  if self._collapse:
1933  options.append("collapse({0})".format(self._collapse))
1934  if self._independent:
1935  options.append("independent")
1936  options_str = " ".join(options)
1937 
1938  parent.add(DirectiveGen(parent, "acc", "begin", "loop", options_str))
1939 
1940  for child in self.children:
1941  child.gen_code(parent)
1942 
1943 
1944 class OMPDirective(Directive):
1945  '''
1946  Base class for all OpenMP-related directives
1947 
1948  '''
1949  @property
1950  def dag_name(self):
1951  '''
1952  :returns: the name to use in a dag for this node
1953  :rtype: str
1954  '''
1955  return "OMP_directive_" + str(self.abs_position)
1956 
1957  def view(self, indent=0):
1958  '''
1959  Print a text representation of this node to stdout and then
1960  call the view() method of any children.
1961 
1962  :param indent: Depth of indent for output text
1963  :type indent: integer
1964  '''
1965  print(self.indent(indent) + self.coloured_text + "[OMP]")
1966  for entity in self._children:
1967  entity.view(indent=indent + 1)
1968 
1969  def _get_reductions_list(self, reduction_type):
1970  '''Return the name of all scalars within this region that require a
1971  reduction of type reduction_type. Returned names will be unique. '''
1972  result = []
1973  for call in self.calls():
1974  for arg in call.arguments.args:
1975  if arg.type in MAPPING_SCALARS.values():
1976  if arg.descriptor.access == \
1977  MAPPING_REDUCTIONS[reduction_type]:
1978  if arg.name not in result:
1979  result.append(arg.name)
1980  return result

1983 class OMPParallelDirective(OMPDirective):
1984 
1985  @property
1986  def dag_name(self):
1987  ''' Return the name to use in a dag for this node'''
1988  return "OMP_parallel_" + str(self.abs_position)
1989 
1990  def view(self, indent=0):
1991  '''
1992  Print a text representation of this node to stdout and then
1993  call the view() method of any children.
1994 
1995  :param indent: Depth of indent for output text
1996  :type indent: integer
1997  '''
1998  print(self.indent(indent) + self.coloured_text + "[OMP parallel]")
1999  for entity in self._children:
2000  entity.view(indent=indent + 1)
2001 
2002  def gen_code(self, parent):
2003  '''Generate the fortran OMP Parallel Directive and any associated
2004  code'''
2005  from psyclone.f2pygen import DirectiveGen, AssignGen, UseGen, \
2006  CommentGen, DeclGen
2007 
2008  private_list = self._get_private_list()
2009 
2010  reprod_red_call_list = self.reductions(reprod=True)
2011  if reprod_red_call_list:
2012  # we will use a private thread index variable
2013  name_space_manager = NameSpaceFactory().create()
2014  thread_idx = name_space_manager.create_name(
2015  root_name="th_idx", context="PSyVars", label="thread_index")
2016  private_list.append(thread_idx)
2017  # declare the variable
2018  parent.add(DeclGen(parent, datatype="integer",
2019  entity_decls=[thread_idx]))
2020  private_str = self.list_to_string(private_list)
2021 
2022  # We're not doing nested parallelism so make sure that this
2023  # omp parallel region is not already within some parallel region
2024  self._not_within_omp_parallel_region()
2025 
2026  # Check that this OpenMP PARALLEL directive encloses other
2027  # OpenMP directives. Although it is valid OpenMP if it doesn't,
2028  # this almost certainly indicates a user error.
2029  self._encloses_omp_directive()
2030 
2031  calls = self.reductions()
2032 
2033  # first check whether we have more than one reduction with the same
2034  # name in this Schedule. If so, raise an error as this is not
2035  # supported for a parallel region.
2036  names = []
2037  for call in calls:
2038  name = call.reduction_arg.name
2039  if name in names:
2040  raise GenerationError(
2041  "Reduction variables can only be used once in an invoke. "
2042  "'{0}' is used multiple times, please use a different "
2043  "reduction variable".format(name))
2044  else:
2045  names.append(name)
2046 
2047  zero_reduction_variables(calls, parent)
2048 
2049  parent.add(DirectiveGen(parent, "omp", "begin", "parallel",
2050  "default(shared), private({0})".
2051  format(private_str)))
2052 
2053  if reprod_red_call_list:
2054  # add in a local thread index
2055  parent.add(UseGen(parent, name="omp_lib", only=True,
2056  funcnames=["omp_get_thread_num"]))
2057  parent.add(AssignGen(parent, lhs=thread_idx,
2058  rhs="omp_get_thread_num()+1"))
2059 
2060  first_type = type(self.children[0])
2061  for child in self.children:
2062  if first_type != type(child):
2063  raise NotImplementedError("Cannot correctly generate code"
2064  " for an OpenMP parallel region"
2065  " containing children of "
2066  "different types")
2067  child.gen_code(parent)
2068 
2069  parent.add(DirectiveGen(parent, "omp", "end", "parallel", ""))
2070 
2071  if reprod_red_call_list:
2072  parent.add(CommentGen(parent, ""))
2073  parent.add(CommentGen(parent, " sum the partial results "
2074  "sequentially"))
2075  parent.add(CommentGen(parent, ""))
2076  for call in reprod_red_call_list:
2077  call.reduction_sum_loop(parent)
2078 
2079  def _get_private_list(self):
2080  '''Returns the variable names used for any loops within a directive
2081  and any variables that have been declared private by a Call
2082  within the directive.
2083 
2084  '''
2085  result = []
2086  # get variable names from all loops that are a child of this node
2087  for loop in self.loops():
2088  if loop._variable_name == "":
2089  raise GenerationError("Internal error: name of loop "
2090  "variable not set.")
2091  if loop._variable_name.lower() not in result:
2092  result.append(loop._variable_name.lower())
2093  # get variable names from all calls that are a child of this node
2094  for call in self.calls():
2095  for variable_name in call.local_vars():
2096  if variable_name == "":
2097  raise GenerationError("Internal error: call has a "
2098  "local variable but its name "
2099  "is not set.")
2100  if variable_name.lower() not in result:
2101  result.append(variable_name.lower())
2102  return result
2103 
2104  def _not_within_omp_parallel_region(self):
2105  ''' Check that this Directive is not within any other
2106  parallel region '''
2107  if self.ancestor(OMPParallelDirective) is not None:
2108  raise GenerationError("Cannot nest OpenMP parallel regions.")
2109 
2110  def _encloses_omp_directive(self):
2111  ''' Check that this Parallel region contains other OpenMP
2112  directives. While it doesn't have to (in order to be valid
2113  OpenMP), it is likely that an absence of directives
2114  is an error on the part of the user. '''
2115  # We need to recurse down through all our children and check
2116  # whether any of them are an OMPDirective.
2117  node_list = self.walk(self.children, OMPDirective)
2118  if len(node_list) == 0:
2119  # TODO raise a warning here so that the user can decide
2120  # whether or not this is OK.
2121  pass
2122  # raise GenerationError("OpenMP parallel region does not enclose "
2123  # "any OpenMP directives. This is probably "
2124  # "not what you want.")
2125 
2126  def update(self):
2127  '''
2128  Updates the fparser2 AST by inserting nodes for this OpenMP
2129  parallel region.
2130 
2131  :raises InternalError: if the existing AST doesn't have the \
2132  correct structure to permit the insertion \
2133  of the OpenMP parallel region.
2134  '''
2135  from fparser.common.readfortran import FortranStringReader
2136  from fparser.two.Fortran2003 import Comment
2137  # Check that we haven't already been called
2138  if self._ast:
2139  return
2140  # Find the locations in which we must insert the begin/end
2141  # directives...
2142  # Find the children of this node in the AST of our parent node
2143  try:
2144  start_idx = self._parent._ast.content.index(self._children[0]._ast)
2145  end_idx = self._parent._ast.content.index(self._children[-1]._ast)
2146  except (IndexError, ValueError):
2147  raise InternalError("Failed to find locations to insert "
2148  "begin/end directives.")
2149  # Create the start directive
2150  text = "!$omp parallel default(shared), private({0})".format(
2151  ",".join(self._get_private_list()))
2152  startdir = Comment(FortranStringReader(text,
2153  ignore_comments=False))
2154  # Create the end directive and insert it after the node in
2155  # the AST representing our last child
2156  enddir = Comment(FortranStringReader("!$omp end parallel",
2157  ignore_comments=False))
2158  # If end_idx+1 takes us beyond the range of the list then the
2159  # element is appended to the list
2160  self._parent._ast.content.insert(end_idx+1, enddir)
2161 
2162  # Insert the start directive (do this second so we don't have
2163  # to correct end_idx)
2164  self._ast = startdir
2165  self._parent._ast.content.insert(start_idx, self._ast)
2166

2168 class OMPDoDirective(OMPDirective):
2169  '''
2170  Class representing an OpenMP DO directive in the PSyclone AST.
2171 
2172  :param list children: list of Nodes that are children of this Node.
2173  :param parent: the Node in the AST that has this directive as a child.
2174  :type parent: :py:class:`psyclone.psyGen.Node`
2175  :param str omp_schedule: the OpenMP schedule to use.
2176  :param bool reprod: whether or not to generate code for run-reproducible \
2177  OpenMP reductions.
2178 
2179  '''
2180  def __init__(self, children=None, parent=None, omp_schedule="static",
2181  reprod=None):
2182 
2183  if children is None:
2184  children = []
2185 
2186  if reprod is None:
2187  self._reprod = Config.get().reproducible_reductions
2188  else:
2189  self._reprod = reprod
2190 
2191  self._omp_schedule = omp_schedule
2192 
2193  # Call the init method of the base class once we've stored
2194  # the OpenMP schedule
2195  super(OMPDoDirective, self).__init__(children=children,
2196  parent=parent)
2197 
2198  @property
2199  def dag_name(self):
2200  ''' Return the name to use in a dag for this node'''
2201  return "OMP_do_" + str(self.abs_position)
2202 
2203  def view(self, indent=0):
2204  '''
2205  Write out a textual summary of the OpenMP Do Directive and then
2206  call the view() method of any children.
2207 
2208  :param indent: Depth of indent for output text
2209  :type indent: integer
2210  '''
2211  if self.reductions():
2212  reprod = "[reprod={0}]".format(self._reprod)
2213  else:
2214  reprod = ""
2215  print(self.indent(indent) + self.coloured_text +
2216  "[OMP do]{0}".format(reprod))
2217 
2218  for entity in self._children:
2219  entity.view(indent=indent + 1)
2220 
2221  def _reduction_string(self):
2222  ''' Return the OMP reduction information as a string '''
2223  reduction_str = ""
2224  for reduction_type in MAPPING_REDUCTIONS.keys():
2225  reductions = self._get_reductions_list(reduction_type)
2226  for reduction in reductions:
2227  reduction_str += ", reduction({0}:{1})".format(
2228  OMP_OPERATOR_MAPPING[reduction_type], reduction)
2229  return reduction_str
2230 
2231  @property
2232  def reprod(self):
2233  ''' returns whether reprod has been set for this object or not '''
2234  return self._reprod
2235 
2236  def gen_code(self, parent):
2237  '''
2238  Generate the f2pygen AST entries in the Schedule for this OpenMP do
2239  directive.
2240 
2241  :param parent: the parent Node in the Schedule to which to add our \
2242  content.
2243  :type parent: sub-class of :py:class:`psyclone.f2pygen.BaseGen`
2244  :raises GenerationError: if this "!$omp do" is not enclosed within \
2245  an OMP Parallel region.
2246  '''
2247  from psyclone.f2pygen import DirectiveGen
2248 
2249  # It is only at the point of code generation that we can check for
2250  # correctness (given that we don't mandate the order that a user
2251  # can apply transformations to the code). As an orphaned loop
2252  # directive, we must have an OMPRegionDirective as an ancestor
2253  # somewhere back up the tree.
2254  if not self.ancestor(OMPParallelDirective,
2255  excluding=[OMPParallelDoDirective]):
2256  raise GenerationError("OMPOrphanLoopDirective must have an "
2257  "OMPRegionDirective as ancestor")
2258 
2259  if self._reprod:
2260  local_reduction_string = ""
2261  else:
2262  local_reduction_string = self._reduction_string()
2263 
2264  # As we're an orphaned loop we don't specify the scope
2265  # of any variables so we don't have to generate the
2266  # list of private variables
2267  options = "schedule({0})".format(self._omp_schedule) + \
2268  local_reduction_string
2269  parent.add(DirectiveGen(parent, "omp", "begin", "do", options))
2270 
2271  for child in self.children:
2272  child.gen_code(parent)
2273 
2274  # make sure the directive occurs straight after the loop body
2275  position = parent.previous_loop()
2276  parent.add(DirectiveGen(parent, "omp", "end", "do", ""),
2277  position=["after", position])

2281  ''' Class for the !$OMP PARALLEL DO directive. This inherits from
2282  both OMPParallelDirective (because it creates a new OpenMP
2283  thread-parallel region) and OMPDoDirective (because it
2284  causes a loop to be parallelised). '''
2285 
2286  def __init__(self, children=[], parent=None, omp_schedule="static"):
2287  OMPDoDirective.__init__(self,
2288  children=children,
2289  parent=parent,
2290  omp_schedule=omp_schedule)

2299  Write out a textual summary of the OpenMP Parallel Do Directive

2302  :param indent: Depth of indent for output text
